overview_of_class: This course attempts to answer the questions, "What is Judaism?" and "Who is a Jew?" by surveying the broad arc of Jewish history, reviewing the practices and beliefs that have defined and continue to define Judaism as a religion, sampling the vast treasure of Jewish literatures and analyzing the unique social conditions that have made the cultural experience of Jewishness so significant. The class will employ an historical structure to trace the evolutions of Jewish literature, religion and culture through the ages.
name: Introduction to Judaism
title: WCAS RELIGION 230-0-26 Introduction to Judaism

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course attempts to answer the questions, "What is Judaism?" and "Who is a Jew?" by surveying the broad arc of Jewish history, reviewing the practices and beliefs that have defined and continue to define Judaism as a religion, sampling the vast treasure of Jewish literatures and analyzing the unique social conditions that have made the cultural experience of Jewishness so significant. The class will employ an historical structure to trace the evolutions of Jewish literature, religion and culture through the ages.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
- To gain familiarity with the general contours of Jewish History.
- To sample the various forms of Jewish cultural expression, including Jewish literature.
- To recognize both the commonalities and varieties within different religious expressions of Judaism.
